Brazosport Water Authority

Executive Summary

A) BWA policy to perform work in a manner that protects the health and safety of employees and the public, preserves the quality of the environment and prevents property damages using BWA  Safety and Chlorine Systems SOP Manual.



Brazosport Water Authority release policies are as follows: 1. Utilize written job procedures involving handling of chlorine. 2. All BWA Personnel annually review written procedures. 3. All operations and maintenance personnel are trained (in-house and TCEQ classes).  4. All operations and maintenance personnel are required to obtain and maintain a "C" surface water license from TCEQ. 5. All operation and maintenance personnel are annually SCBA trained.  6. Chlorine gas system is vacuum from regulator on the liquid chlorine cylinder to the water aspirator.   



Emergency Response policies are as follows: 1. Notify Lake Jackson Fire Dept. 2. Notify Dow Fire Department. 3. Notify local Hazmat team for large leaks. 4. Do not attempt a repair of a leak or rescue without self contained breathing air apparatus. 5. Evacuate all non essential personnel  

6. All maintenance and operations BWA  Personnel are annually trained and certified on SCBA  7. All maintenance and operations BWA Personnel are Bi-Annually trained and certified in CPR and First Aid via Red Cross. 



B) Brazosport Water Authority maintains liquid chlorine in 2,000 pound cylinders and 150 pound containers on site for disinfection of drinking water.

Chlorine maximum amount is 43,000 pounds



C) The general accidental release prevention program

   1. All repetitive jobs require a written procedure

      all SOP include consequences of deviation! 

   2. All operators and maintenance personnel are trained in release prevention

   3. Require all operators and maintenance personnel to be SCBA trained

   4. Review all chemical carriers for safety and release prevention program

   

  D)  Accidental release chlorine prevention

1. All operators and maintenance personnel are trained in release prevention

   2. Only AWWA and Chlorine Institute approved chlorine equipment and materials are utilized

   3. All chlorine handling tasks require a written approved job procedure and annual review

   4. All chlorine carriers are reviewed for accidental release prevention training program

   5. Daily inspection of chlorination system

   6. Periodic testing of chlorine leak detection system

   7. Periodically, test and inspection of all chlorine regulators and chlorine dioxide generators



  E) Five year accident history

    There have been no reportable accidental releases for chlorine from Brazosport Water Authority

     Water Plant in the past five years.



  F) Planned changes to improve safety

   1. Continue with monthly safety topic with written modules

   2. Continue to have personnel take TCEQ Safety Classes. 



  G) Prevention Program Training 

      Certification and documentation of Operators training

     1. BWA certified all operators working as of June 21, 1999.

     2. Operators trained after June 21, 1999 tested or certified by BWA Management.

         



   H) Prevention Program Maintenance

       Documentation of:

      1. Formal written preventive maintenance program for all

         chlorine equipment or chlorine handling equipment.

         See BWA Chlorine equipment inspection and maintenance log.

     2. Chlorine Delivery contractor's delivery equipment properly maintained and

         operator is properly trained.

     3. Chlorine process equipment has been tested and inspected according to

         recognized and generally accepted engineering practices.

      

    I) Emergency Response policies are as follows: 

      1. BWA facility first responder is shift leader operator on duty.

      2. BWA first responder will notify Lake Jackson Fire Dept., Dow Fire Department and Local Hazmat Team when needed. 

      3. Do not attempt a major leak repair

unless certified in Hazmat. 

      4. Evacuate all non essential personnel.  

      5. Medical help if needed.

          Refer to  BWA Emergency Response Plan (Updated February 2020)
